" 1 most ardently desire/ writes the King of Prussia to Bonaparte, 'that Your Majesty should be received and treated in my palace in a man- ner agreeable to yourself, and in so far as cir- 
cumstances allowed, I have hastened to take all steps to that end. May I have succeeded!' The Prussian generals pride themselves on be- ing polite to the French and lay down their arms at the first demand.
